poem:
**In the Wake of Change**

The datacenter hums  
beneath Virginia's hills,  
where once the quiet  
fields stood unchallenged.  
A man—half rooted in  
old soils, half reaching  
for new skies—  
unseats the machines.  
In the echo  
of democracy's whisper,  
a softer revolution stirs,  
a shout in the quiet,  
heartbeats inscribing the land.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Virginia Democrat flips seat in state legislature by taking on datacenters John McAuliff, a 33-year-old small business owner and former civil servant, was one of the more unlikely Democrats to win election to Virginia’s legislature this month, after a campaign in which he could, at times, come off a bit like a Republican. McAuliff was among the 13 Democrats elected to the legislature in Virginia’s elections earlier this month, as part of a blowout victory". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Virginia Democrat flips seat in state legislature by taking on datacenters John McAuliff, a 33-year-old small business owner and former civil servant, was one of the more unlikely Democrats to win election to Virginia’s legislature this month, after a campaign in which he could, at times, come off a bit like a Republican. McAuliff was among the 13 Democrats elected to the legislature in Virginia’s elections earlier this month, as part of a blowout victory
